content: Start your first activity. Click to add one.
This is the activity editor, where you add and edit your questions. Give your activity a title, then click Next.
In the settings menu, you can set an outcome type, a theme, and attach curriculum codes.
Clicking this button opens the New Question menu. Choose Fill the Blanks to continue.

You can add a title, description, and image for this question.

Each type of question includes different fields for you to edit.
Questions have settings. Change question point values, attach curriculum codes, and more in here.
Question previews appear on this side.
Preview the whole activity before assigning it to your class.
Assign the activity to your class. But first, let's go add a student.
Click to add a new class.
Add a student by giving them a display name and a password. Students get a unique Username which they can use to login.
Manage your Class & Students later from this menu. Now, let’s return to assigning your activity.
To assign: choose your students, select a start date (plus an optional end date), then confirm.
Also share your activity on Google Classroom after assigning.
Results will show up here as soon as a students completes the activity. Almost done, one last thing...
Under Templates, you'll find quality, pre-written activities for you to use. Just copy them, edit, then assign!
Now it’s over to you! Thanks for your time. Be sure to check out our help articles for more tips for using Assess.
